abstract: The ouster of The Wall Street Journal’s top editor last week did not live up to the conditions that the News Corporation agreed to when it bought the paper, an oversight committee said.
snippet: The ouster of The Wall Street Journal’s top editor last week did not live up to the conditions that the News Corporation agreed to when it bought the paper, an oversight committee said.
lead_paragraph: The ouster of The Wall Street Journal’s top editor last week did not live up to conditions that the News Corporation had agreed to when it bought Dow Jones & Company in December, a special oversight committee for the newspaper said Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Journal Panel Says Ouster Of Editor Violated Accord
